alert.note: Alert for Clark (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 20 at 6:22AM CDT until May 20 at 6:45AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 AM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN HANCOCK...CENTRAL LEE AND NORTHEASTERN CLARK COUNTIES... At 621 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Summitville, or near Nauvoo, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to vehicles is expected. This severe storm will be near... Montrose, Galland, Sandusky and Camp Eastman around 625 AM CDT. Nauvoo, Nauvoo State Park and Bluff Park around 630 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Fort Madison, Niota, Colusa, Fort Madison Municipal Arpt, Sawyer, Dallas City, Pontoosuc, Wever and Augusta. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and deadly cloud to ground lightning. Seek shelter inside a well-built structure. Stay away from windows. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
